text: Pours black with khaki head. Scent and taste are replete with coffee. Dark chocolate also makes its presence known. Slight bell pepper spice at the end of the nose. Some toffee in the taste. Heavy body and smooth texture. Mildly bitter coffee finish.

Black color. Medium-sized , beige head. Aroma of coffee, and dark chocolate. Coffee and roasted malt flavor. Roasted bitterness all the way.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap t city tap house. Pours black some head some lacing. Nose is fruity and coffee.
Flavours big coffee dark fruit some dark chicolateS. Taste med bitter big sweet.
Medium creamy body lively carbonation.

Pours a dark black and you will notice the coffee aroma right away. Lots of coffee flavor in this one but not bitter like coffee can be sometimes. A bit of chocolate and malt rounds this out to make it a very nice brew.

Totalmente negra, espuma marrom cremosa de ótima formação e persistência. No aroma bastante café e chocolate, um pouco de nozes e amêndoas. Paladar de médio amargor e leve dulçor. Corpo denso, cremosa como um milkshake de chocolate, média/alta carbonatação. Final de torrado prevalecente mas sem cansar o paladar, muito bem dosada, não sei o que poderia melhorar.

Bottled 10/16. Pours pitch black, tan head. Aroma is overwhelmingly coffee, roasted malt, some chocolate. Mostly coffee, and some roastedness. Flavor is coffee heavy, chocolate, roasted malt, bitter coffee finish. Fairly full-bodied. A little one-dimensional, frankly, but the body is solid, the coffee bitterness in the finish is there without being over the top, and its pleasant. Simple, but good execution. Id have it again.
Pours dark brown big thick head. Aromas big coffee, slight chocolate,light wood. Flavors big coffee, light cocoa, astringent bitter finish. Medium sweet. Decent.

January 2017 - Bottle in Barcelona, picked up at BierCaB for about 7, as Bells Java Stout, 7.5%. Opaque black with a foamy brown head. Aroma is rich coffee, toffee, caramel and some light green pepper. The coffee character has that slightly faded vegetal note which you get in this sort of beer after a couple of months. Body is smooth with soft to tingly carbonation. Taste is rich coffee liqueur offset with an earthy dryness, some cardboard and light tart red berry notes. Like all coffee beers, this would be at its best fresh. But this is still a very tasty beer.

Bottle, 355ml. Opaque black, small creamy light brown head. Aromas of coffee, spices, nuts. Medium to full bodied. Smooth and creamy. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Rich roasted coffee flavors. Spicy finish. Very pleasant.

From a bottle into a North Coast chalice. Pours black with brown head and lace. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Medium carbonation and significant mouthfeel. Flavors of dark chocolate, roasty malts, slight grains, coffee, milk chocolate, malted milk balls. Overall rich and lovely. Bells has for many years made a vast array of lovely stouts, and this is one of them.

Pours a dark brown color with a roasted malt aroma. Taste is truly coffee, distinctly espresso, with a nice stoutly beer flavor. The alcohol content is well hidden in the overall flavor of the beer. Good chocolate with minor bitterness in the aftertaste.

Bells Java Stout smells, tastes, and even looks like a glass of fresh-brewed Sumatra. If you love the bold, roasty, bitter, and (dark) chocolaty characteristics from this Indonesian variety, youll probably love this Stout. Java Stout has notes of all that with some char and probably even a fair amount of caffeine. Maybe Ill have one with breakfast.

Draft.

A- Roasty, bitter, coffee.

A- Black color, black liquid, tan head.

T- Coffee, vegetal, bitter.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, bitter finish.

O- Too much of the earthy vegetal coffee and not enough sweetness for me. I thought maybe a dirty tap line was the reason for this but I think it just isnt ass rich as I hoped.

12 oz bottle. Bottled on 10/16/15. (Bells) Kalamazoo, MI.
Black color with a small tan head. 
Roasted malt, coffee and some sweetness in the aroma. Coffee is really strong. Bit of a problem for me. The flavor is even stronger... I cant get much more than coffee... roasted malt and some sweetness. Rich.

12oz bottle tasted on the 19/10/2016. Opaque black colour with a small tan brown head. Aroma of roasted coffee, beans and some chocolate. Taste is very roasty. Lots of coffee beans and some chocolate. Next one please!
From Labirratorium. In Teku glass. Playing Magic Duels. Coffee very noticeable here without being unpleasant, although Id prefer a bit less. Leaves a sticky moutheel.

12oz bottle - very dark black pour (like motor oil) with a thin tan head. Massive coffee aroma with lots of roasted grain, dark chocolate and more espresso. Rich flavors (strong coffee, cacao, toffee and burnt notes) and thick mouthfeel. Highly recommended.

Bottle@ät, Nyköping. Pitch black color with minimal tanned head. Aroma has roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla. Taste is malty sweet with long a bit bitter and sweet aftertaste. Flavors of coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, roasted malt and dark fruits. Excellent smoothness is mouth feeling. Very well balanced and not too sweet.

Bottle at RBESG 2016 Grand Tasting Part 1, Brew Pub Le Sec. Very dark brown with a ring tan head. Aroma of green coffee, dark chocolate, roast and caramel. Flavour is light heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Medium to full bodied with an oily texture and soft carbonation. [09-07-2016]

17.09.2016, 12 oz bottle @ home:
Nice light brown bubbly-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich and dry, dark malts, espresso, minerals, roasted grain, toast, vanilla, cocoa, caramel. Taste is slightly dry mineraly, weeds, dark malts, espresso, minerals, bark, hops, toast, burnt caramel, grass. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly harsh burnt and mineraly mouthfeel. Nice.

Tasting session at Budapest. Brown beer, tan head. Nose is beany coffee, chocolate, dry notes, roast. Flavor is mild vanilla, coffee which is less beany than the nose, chocolate. Dry and roasty finish, tobacco, beans.
Bottle. Black pour. Aroma of strong roasted coffee, bitter malt and cream. Taste has creamy bitter coffee, roasted malt, cacao and some caramel. Very nice.

12 oz bottle. Im not sure how in the hell I havent rated this. Jesus. The pour is a lighter black with a thin light khaki head and a little bit of lace left behind. The aroma is good. There is a big heavy coffee from start to finish. There is a light chocolate and a light roasted malt. Its lightly sweet with a bitter coffee. Its pretty good. The flavor is quite similar. There is a bit more sweetness to it. The coffee is still bit and bitter. The mouth feel is thicker for a regular stout and softly carbonated. Its almost perfect there. The coffee and chocolate is just nice. One of the better Bells stouts

4 oz pour on draft at Spacebar. Dark brownish black with light tan head. Aromas of dark chocolate, coffee, roast. Tastes of coffee, dark chocolate, roasty notes, caramel, milk chocolate, vanilla. Medium body with a dry finish. Great coffee stout.
Bottle at home. Black body with a small light brown head. Roasted malt, cold espresso, chocolate, ashy, charcoal.

Bottle at Jeerorgets Brygghus cons 2016-08-06 Göteborg
AR: heavy coffey, wee chocokate powder
AP: dark brown, stouty espresso brown lid
F: heavy coffey , chocolate cake, roasted malt,
Dark pour thick foamy tan head. Strong smell of coffee and chocolate with roasted carmel. Med body. Smooth finish, just right amount of bitter. Starts with chocolate and coffee tingles on the tongue
RBESG 2016 in Barcelona, Grand Tasting. Black colour. Roasty aroma and flavour, distinct coffee, fairly dry.
9th July 2016: shared bottle at the RBESG in Barcelona. Black pour, beige head. Coffee and chocolate flavours dominate this smooth, yet slightly bitter Stout. Liked it.
Dampolla al Grand Tasting del RBESG16. Cervesa amb aromes de gra de café torrat i brioix molt fet. Cos mig i final dolç/amarg. Bona.

Bottle. Seems like a good way to ease out of a Friday afternoon working from home. Near black pour with small cream-colored head that isnt huge but sticks around for a long, long time Aroma initially is dominated by coffee, but after it warms in the glass for a few minutes you realize that theres also a huge rich chocolate component as well. Taste is moderately sweet, with nice finish that dances between roast coffee bitterness and decadent fudgy chocolate. Medium+ body, average carbonation, surprisingly velvety texture. Overall: This is one impressive coffee stout. Loving this.

Bottle shared at RBESG16 thanks to kermis. Almost black with dark beige head. Fresh roasted coffee, cocoa and caramel, dark red fruits, green leaves. Under medium sweet and bitter. Medium bodied. Nice one.

Bottle at home. Black - small light brown head. Coffee aroma and taste. Some sweet notes. Chocolate. Roasted and some burned malts. Light bitterness. Lots of chocolate - dark bitter chocolate. Nice body. High drinkability - if you like coffee.

Svart och lite trög. Tydlig doft av kallt kaffe. Sträv och lite kärv smak. Mycket kaffe och beska

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drank from a shaker, from a bottle, 
the pour gave a large, thick chocolate shake like head of bubbles and the beer was black in the glass, 

the aromas were roasted malt, chocolate and coffee, a bit of caramel, malt, chocolate and brown sugar sweetness, 

it had flavors of big roasted malt, dark and milk chocolate, coffee, a bit of roasted malt bitterness, some brown sugar and a touch of molasses, 
the roasted malt bitterness and coffee gave a good bitterness to balance the malt and chocolate sweetness, the bitterness and coffee hung around on the tongue, 

the mouth feel was medium to the light side of full and it was pretty creamy on the lips, the carbonation was average, 

this stout was a nice mix of roasted malt, chocolate and coffee, this bottle has sat around for more than six months, a fresher bottle would have more coffee and coffee bitterness, this beer was really nice, I recommend this drink.

Bottle 35,5cl.
@ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
A: Black.
T: Roasted malt, coffee, sweet, slightly spicy.
Bottle @ Mikkeller Beershop. Black small creamy head. Lovely coffee roast. Beany, aromatic, tasty and dry. Bitter sticky finish. Smooth and soft. Yes!
Negro opaco y espuma beis. Aromas de café, chocolate. cuerpo sedoso medio-alto, con sabor inicial de chocolate dulce y amargor final tostado y acafetado.
Pour black with a fine brown head. fine coffee aroma, roasted malts, light caramel. medium bitter with sweet notes, full bodied, average carbonations, light bitter aftertaste.

Spectacular. Coffee extremely pronounced in the aroma (though theres chocolate there, too) and the lingering finish. Malty sweetness doing battle with the subtle bitterness of the coffee. Tried it from a bottle both refrigerated to low 40s and at basement temperature (low 60s) and, by far, basement temp was superior. Allowed to rest six months after bottling.
Bottle from Biercab Shop. Black colour with brown head. Coffee, roasted aroma. Coffee, roasted, bitter, dark chocolate taste. Medium to full body.

Pours black with low tanned head 
Aromas intense of espresso, ash, hints of chocolate, dark malts 
Taste has notes of coffee, chocolate, dark fruits, hints of caramel, rye bread 
Medium bodied, dry, medium carbonation, low bitterness
Pours a nice black body with a tan head. Aromas of roasted malts w/coffee and chocolate. Burnt malt/coffee flavors and bitter dark chocolate with maybe a hint of smoke. Excellent Beer
Black, brown foam. Strong coffe with a hint of vanilla and cocoa. Sweet, coffee, chockolate, vanilla, strong sweet, burned coffee in the aftertaste.
Bottle. Beautiful head. Burnt coffee. Silky soft and nice coffee taste. Vanilla.

Stout uwarzony z dodatkiem ziaren kawy Sumatra. 
Kawa używana powszechnie w sieci restauracji Starbucks. 

Kolor nieprzejrzyście czarny. Piana potężna, jasno beżowa, drobnopęcherzykowa. Długo pływa po powierzchni i pięknie krążkuje.
Nad piwiem unosi się gruby, conajmniej 2-centymetrowy wianuszek.
W aromacie dosłownie eksplozja ziaren kawy. Tak mocny aromat kawy czułem kiedyś w piwie Browar Leśniczówka Coffee Smoked Tobacco Ale Aged On Tabacco ;-)))
Głęboko pod nimi ukryte są akcenty gorzkiej czekolady i oczywiście mocna paloność.
W smaku obawiałem się wysokiej kwaskowatości pochodzącej od mocnej kawy. Tymczasem otrzymałem intensywną kawę, ale zbalansowaną akcentami mlecznej czekolady.
Wraz z nimi dodać do całości należy: karmel, wanilię i prażone orzechy.
Goryczka średnia stanowiąca połaczenie sugestii kawowych z czekoladowymi.
Subtelne drapanie na języku od palonych ziaren kawy.
Wysoka pijalność i fenomenalnie gęsta faktura.
Śmiało mogę powiedzieć, że to jedno z najlepszych piwa jakie piłem w USA (a i najlepszych w moim życiu również).

Browar Bells chyba wysuwa się na prowadzenie. Tuż za nim Founders Brewing Co.

330ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Very dark brown color. Small size, brown head, stays. Coffee, chilly, roast, peppery, bit of beans in aroma. Sweet, caramel, chocolate, coffee, peppers in taste. Coffee, peppers and caramel in aftertaste. Soft carbonation. Pleasant mouthfeel. Lovely brew.

(355ml bottle shared @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, April 21 2016) Pours very dark brown with an average medium tan head and lace. Aroma is coffee beans with green pepper, caramel, roast, slight chocolate. Flavour is slightly less green pepper but still coffee bean dominated. Slightly spicy roast over a light to moderately sweet core of caramel, drying to a fairly bitter finish with coffee beans, a bit of dried leaves and vanilla. Medium bodied, average carbonation. I would love it if it had the green pepper bean character dialed down a touch but its still a nice non-imperial coffee stout.

355ml bottle from shop.mikkeller.dk

15071 PKGD 11/20/15 B


Deep black colour with a tan head. Rich roasted coffee aroma and flavour, chocolate, ash, bitterness. Allright.

355ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut! - bottled 20Nov15
Big chilli bean aroma - a bit harsh - some tobacco. More mellow in the mouth, soft and smooth palate. A bit beany in finish. Not doing it for me. Too many beans.

Bottle (from mikkeller webshop). Pours dark brown-black with beige head. Aroma is coffee, roast, malt, roast, sweetness. Flavor is sweet and bitter, coffee, roast, malt, bit acidity from roast Finish is coffee and sweetness. Overall: very good.

Bottle shared by Mart. Brown beer, tan head. Nose is beany coffee, chocolate, dry notes, roast. Flavor is mild vanilla, coffee which is less beany than the nose, chocolate. Dry and roasty finish, tobacco, beans.

You can tell just from the aroma this has a serious coffee flavor. Really great stout with strong coffee notes and bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours black with a low off white head. Aromas of heavily roasted coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts, quite dry on the nose. Taste is very roasted with dark berries and quite bitter notes. Mouthfeel is quite dry with moderate carbonation and medium body.

Bottle from Mikkeller Webshop. Pours black with beige, creamy head. Big espresso aroma with cocoa and dark chocolate. Dry taste with roasted coffee, dark chocolate, light tobacco and hints of vanilla.

Gorgeous pour, deep opaque espresso with cappuchino head. Cascade on pour from bottle is reminiscent of nitro but with bigger bubbles. Dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, and cherry on nose. Very balanced with mild bitterness from coffee and some chocolate sweetness. Medium/full mouthfeel with semi-long finish. Very creamy. Very good.
Super smooth, dead aftertaste... tastes like coffee, sorta flat. Its good.
Poured from bottle thanks Airforcehops dark chocolate brown with a nice mocha head. Aromas of coffee chocolate vanilla and roasted malt. Taste is creamy and follows aroma. Nice.

12 oz bottle poured. Near black, brown pour with a tan foam head. Coffee bean aroma. Flavor is chocolate, coffee and cream, bold roast finish. Top of the line coffee stout. These guys get it. Awesome.

Bottle.

A: Perfectly black with fluffy, foamy mocha head. 

N: Pure espresso mixed with rich dark cocoa. Heavy roast and a woodsy profile. Very earthy. Some lactose and burnt brown sugar. Ample dark roasted malts. 

T: Decently bitter and sweet, in proportion.

M: Medium body, creamy carbonation, no alcohol.

O: A fine quaff. Not quite a chocolate covered espresso bean like the best of them, but certainly an earthier coffee profile that fits the base beer like a glove.

12oz bottle from total wine and spirits. Black with small tan head. The bottle I just bought might have been a bit old. Roasted coffee and chocolate nose. Nice aroma. Chocolate coffee then some roasty malt. Finishes a bit flat and metallic. Solid body, medium creaminess. Flavor just doesnt carry through like Id hope.

Black with Creamy tan head. Aroma of black coffee. Flavors of Coffee and dark roasted malts. Black coffee flavor forward. Very strong. Slick pallet medium mouth feel. Soft carbonation. Aftertaste of black coffee.
Pours black with a big tan head. Intense coffee aroma. Slightly sweet and bitter coffee flavors alternate, also some dark fruit. Highly carbonated mouthfeel.

Where: Old Line Fine Wine Spirits & Bistro. 
How: 12 ounce bottle.
Appearance: pours black with a thick foamy tan head with excellent retention.
Aroma: roasted coffee, burnt chocolate, cocoa. 
Taste: Roasted coffee and unsweetened cocoa, followed by sweet milk chocolate. 
Palate: medium bodied and smooth.
Overall: very good roasted stout, good for anytime, especially winter.

Aroma of black coffee, oak and roasted malt. A bit one-note, but nice. Looks great - Midnight black with the slightest amount of light tan foam. Taste is strong coffee bitterness with undertones of roast, cream, oak and vanilla. Underwhelming palate. Good beer, but I could use more. A thicker palate and higher ABV would help. The coffee just overpowers everything.
12oz bottle. Pours black with thin tan head. Aroma is Coffee, Chocolate and Malt. Taste is sweet malt coffee up front with a coffee finish. I like it.

355ml bottle bottled 09/11/14. Pours a near black with a thin tan head that thins to a ring. Aroma has big, smooth notes of roasted malts, coffee, nut shells, dark chocolate, and traces of caramel. Taste is balanced with lots of cold-pressed coffee, dark roasted malts, chocolate, slight dark fruits, and an espresso bitter ending. Medium-full body with a medium carbonation. Clean in the mouth with a bone dry finish. Overall a really nice coffee beer. Still lots of coffee with smooth roast. Highly recommended.

12 ounce bottle from Bine & Vine, purchased 14 months ago ($3.49). "Packaged 09/11/14." POURS dark brown (almost black) with a half finger of brown foam. AROMA of rough-ground dark coffee, roasted and lightly smoky malts, roasted nuts, with some fading chocolate. FLAVOR mainly of strong coffee (creamy espresso-laden cafe au lait comes to mind), with additional notes of vanilla, creamy chocolate, and Kahlua (though this is not very sweet at all). Some lingering coffee-bitterness. A nice creamy mouthfeel. Not particularly complex but really very well executed, and that goes a long way. (1532, 1001)
Aromas of roasted malts, coffee, and milk chocolate. Taste is roasted malts and coffee, also some milk chocolate in the finish.
Solid beer, but the coffee flavor doesnt come through as much as Id like in a (borderline) Imperial Coffee Stout
Pours a dark black. Has a strong chocolate, coffee, and malt aroma. A nice mixed flavor of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, caramel and a malt bitterness. A sweet but dry aftertaste.
Bottle from whole foods, orlando. Black color, brown head. Aroma has black chocolate, coffee, vanilla and spices. Full roasty body, vanilla, coffee, chocolate and spices. Very nice.

Black pour with a ruby hue and tan head with light lacing ... Aroma of fresh coffee beans, dark chocolate, roasted malts and caramel malts very strong coffee aroma .... Taste is of rich coffee, dark chocolate/cocoa, roasted malts and caramel malts .... Has some bitter hop bite on the back end that lingers into the finish which is very dry and rich..... Body is full and the abv is hidden well .... Mouthfeel is slick and oily
Another great stout from bells. Had six pack from Holmes. Great aroma of roasted coffee and taste too. Nice thick malty stout with plenty of body. Great beer
Dark chocolate , espresso bean, earthy bitterness, anise, dried blueberry, lingering dry roasty/nutty finish.

Bottled. Smooth mouthful. Low carbonation. Quite bitter like coffee. Enjoyable b

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark body with minimal tan head. Massive coffe aroma. The flavor is dominated by... you guessed it, coffee. Mid-taste some realy nice stout flavors develop to save the day. Had this not happened this would be alcoholic coffee. Since things mellowed out mid-swallow and the finish is so very nice this beer scores well. Those Kalamazoo folks sure do know how to make stouts

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2015 On tap at Max?s, Fells Point, Baltimore.   Aroma is coffee. Smoked meats. Dark black, small off white head. Taste is smoke, salt, coffee, roasted barley. Tobacco. Feel is thin, medium low carbonation. Really interesting stout. Love the smoke. Good beer.

12 oz bottle, packaged 11/20/15. Dark black with a creamy tan head. Sheets of sticky lace coat the glass in its wake.  Aroma is strong brewed coffee, chocolate. Flavor is coffee, chocolate, cream, dark roasted malt.
Pours black with a sweet aroma. Has a bitter roasted flavor with an after kick of dark espresso/coffee.

Bottle share at Evernote in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is spend coffee grounds, old iced coffee, vanilla, tobacco. Taste is sharp coffee with acidy notes. Some sweetness in there and dark leathery bits. A bit too sharp, acidy, old coffee for me.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2016 12oz bottle, poured into a shaker. The aroma is rich with chocolate and coffee and has an undertone not too dissimilar to wood resin. The beer is a rich, oily, black brown topped with a brown, dense soap head that has moderate-light retention, and a touch of lace. The beer?s texture is syrupy with foamy carbonation. The medium body carries a taste of moderate bittersweetness with a chocolate espresso flavor profile and a light toffee and nuts undertone. The finish is surprisingly clean and fresh with a chalkiness consistency and lactose flavor this turns to an aftertaste of dark chocolate that?s very light and mellow.

It pours black with a dark brown head. It has aromas of coffee and chocolate. It has flavors of coffee, chocolate, and roasted malts. It has a high level of carbonation with a light heavy rich texture to it. It has a coffee like bitter finish.

pours a rich dark brown with a big brown head. Nose is potent coffee and hops with just a touch of brown sugar.flavour lives up to its name with a strong java overtone and a slightly bitter and tart malt. alcohol is well hidden. Not my style but its well made

How: Bottle (12 oz) at home.

>>> A flavorful, well balanced and easy drinking coffee Stout. Bells are good with dark beers. 

-  Dark brown with a medium easy to revive creamy brown head, good retention and little lacing. 
-  Its bursting with espresso beans flavors in both aroma and taste. 
-  Sweetness is moderate and the beer is rather well balanced. Strong espresso is working harmoniously with a rich dark chocolate presence and roasted malts. 
-  Fully bodied stout with medium carbontion and a rich oily mouthfeel. 
-  Despite 7,5% abv, the beer isnt boozy at all and despite being quite flavorful its also fairly drinkable. 
-  Theres a mild coffee acidity in taste. 

Flavors:  Espresso beans, dark chocolate, roasted malts, caramel, mild herbal notes, mild acidity (taste).
Bottle in Detroit Airport. Nice black body with slight head. Nose of coffee, malts and chocolate. Taste is coffee, quite roasty and chocolate. Very smooth texture. Enjoyable.
Pours black with heavy tan head. Aroma is roasted barley. Coffee. Flavoer is coffee and some vanilla with lots of roasted barley and a very nice finish of coffee and roasty.
Delicious and one of the best coffee stouts I have tried. Very creamy and soft although not in avb.

355 ml bottle. Enjoyed at Los Angeles, CA. Pours a black colour with a small beige head. Rich aroma of roasted malts, espresso and biscuit. Flavour of rich roastiness, some vanilla, heavy espresso, grassy bitterness and caramel sweetness. Full bodied. Extremely rich and tasty. Awesome.

Black with a light brown head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, vanilla, cardamom, molasses, dates. Full bodied, slightly creamy mouthfeel, rich and lightly roasty on the palate with a slightly dry powdery coffee bean finish. Taste is coffee, dark chocolate, hazelnut, cocoa, vanilla. Tasty
Bottle. Dark cola with a tan head. Very solid coffee stout with notes of coffee and chocolate. On the sweet side of things but not in a bad way. Good.

Bottle. Black. Big dark roast black coffee throughout with chocolate. Really smooth and rich. Excellent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle to snifter. No detailed notes - entering form older tastings. Really heavy on the coffee, but you should probably expect that from the name and description. A little bitter.

Smells like chocolate and coffee. Low to medium carbonation. Very lightly foamy and creamy mouthfeel. Thick and syrupy. Taste is dark chocolate and roasted black coffee. The most prominent flavor is the coffee, and boy is it strong. Aftertaste is long length and the same, with a bit of alcohol warmness and bitterness (unfortunately).

Aromas of espresso, mocha, coffee rinds, black coffee beans, roasted malt, dark malts and earth. Appears black with a thin tan rim. Taste is strong cold pressed coffee, espresso, cappuccino, mocha, roasted malt, char, earthy malts. campfire burn, subtle chocolate and some plum juice. Overall, if youre a fan of coffee beers this is the one for you.Coffee dominates the aroma and taste.

6 ounce sample from a 12 ounce bottle. Aroma has some mocha coffee hints present. A bit charry and metallic. Pretty nice. Mostly opaque black body with a medium light tan head. Super coffee like flavor in the start. Medium roast in the middle. Mediocre sweetness. Good stuff.

Pours a very dark brown, almost black, with a tan head. Aromas of coffee along with dark roasted malt and some chocolate. Flavour is predominantly coffee and roasted malt, chocolate and a nice bitter finish. Great full body.

Nice black pour with a light brown head. Heavy coffee aroma upfront. Tastes of coffee, bitter chocolate and roasted malt. Lots of flavor here. Nice thick texture. Really good beer from Bell,
s.
Old rating. Awesome coffee forward beer. Pretty much espresso/coffee flavor all the way through. Maybe a little oak and chocolate too. Not too heavy. Real tasty.
Pours very dark brown, with a tan head. Aroma of rich dark coffee. Taste is similarly heavy with good coffee. A very good, uniquely coffee-oriented brew. Thumbs up!
Very dark coffee smell, very dark, heavy and strong coffee but fairly smooth, finishes with coffee grounds but not in a bad way, coffee is all you taste though, one dimensional...

A unique beer, as youll see a lot of "coffee" beers that you barely taste the coffee. This java stout tastes exactly as it sounds. Was a little on the strong side (alcohol content) for its flavor, but Im certain thats what they were shooting for. Relatively heavy for a stout, with a bitter aftertaste.
A little woody. A little thin with a hint of burnt coffee. Not bad. Solid take on the style

Pours a solid black with a tan head. It has a nice coffee aroma with some toasted malt and a bit of coffee. The flavor is rich coffee and toast with a bit of chocolate and a smooth, slightly dark chocolate finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Overt coffee and rich malt. Pours black with a massive brown head that lingers well. Roast and coffee dominate flavor with a slight fruitiness (dark fruits) on the end. Moderate bittering, could be a little from the roast. A very slight sourness appears in this beer, which is nice. Coffee is a little overpowering.

Jet black with a khaki head. Smells of coffee, anise, dark roasted malt. Huge coffee taste. Fairly creamy not getting the chocolate of most stouts and way more coffee. If you like coffee beers this is a good one to try.

Bottle at home while in Jacksonville. Pours dark brown/black with a red edge and a tan head. Nice aroma with milk choc, light grass, light vanilla and sweet milky coffee. Medium to full body, medium carbonation. Theres woody toasty ash, milk and bitter dark choc, slightly stale coffee, hint of mustiness, vanilla, light hazelnut... Creamy, smooth, lovely balance and very tasty.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2016 2016 re-rate: Huge Indonesian nose still present. Lots of french press notes. Roasted cacao nibs. More bakers chocolate on the palate. Bone dry, espresso. Dry finish that lingers like a nice 80% cacao bite. Old rating: 355ml bottle shared with Marcus in January 2015 from Old Town in Louisville. Poured into a shaker pint. Oil black with a big soapy tan head. Huge dark-roasted Indonesian coffee aromas with undertones of toasted oats, smoke and slight earthiness. Taste is more of the same with the roasted coffee again dominating. Slight vanilla and dark fruit tastes emerge as it comes to room temperature. Creamy mouthfeel and full-bodied with a dry bitter smoky finish.

Poured into a shaker showing oily black with dark copper translucent rims and half a finger of coffee colored foam. 

The coffee does show but its a sideshow compared to the very dominant grassy aromas emanating from this beer. 

The palate is full bodied, with extremely even carbonation, immediately showing the dark coffee flavors without any of the tartness, and a very elegant dark chocolate bitterness on the end. The coffee linger on the finish is very long. Actually very similar to drinking a nice black coffee. Delicious!

Completely opaque black, big foamy billowy tan head with good retention and very nice lace. Big coffee aromas dominate, with notes of roasted grain and dark fruit. pleasant sense of smoke as well. Lots of dark roasted coffee flavor, some dark fruit sweetness, earth and wood, and a gentle alcohol warmth. Mild hopping provides a balancing bitterness. Medium to full body, creamy mouthfeel, moderate carbonation and a lingering smokiness.

スタウト  
コーヒーの香& 
程よいあまさ

Pours a dark black with a khaki colored head. Nose is dark chocolate and dark roast coffee with a roasted malt scent. Medium body with a nice bitter coffee bite on the front with a smooth finish. Excellent lacing. One of the best Coffee Stouts Ive ever tasted.

Poured a dark brown/ black colour with a small tan head. Aroma of sweet coffee and roasted malts. Taste is coffee, carmel, and roasted malts with a light bitterness. Very sweet and natural coffee elements in this medium bodied brew with a chewy/ smooth mouthfeel and a warm bitter finish.

This is a very distinctive coffee stout, one that sets itself apart with its bright coffee flavor (as opposed to a burnt/old coffee that is apparent in many others of the same variety, such as Sierra Nevada's). This is solid all around, something I'd drink again and again. Cheers.

Bottle, via IP trade with dresden-- thanks Steve! Dark brown, medium brown head. Rich coffee aroma and flavour, nice bitter black malts, sweet undertones, maybe a bit of hazelnut? A great coffee stout!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottled on 10/15/12. Poured from 12 oz into 16oz tulip. Minimal head. Heavy malt roast, with medium coffee notes.
Very dark brown pour, small brown head. Huge roasty coffee aroma, flavor of flavor is big coffee, vanilla, chocolate notes.

Bottle from Bells General Store in Kalamazoo. Pour is black with a thin, creamy, beige head. Aroma is coffee with hints of vanilla and cocoa. Taste is thick, smooth coffee and coca. Faint touch of bitterness on the finish but barely noticeable. Very thick, full body. Overall one of the best stouts Ive had.

I wish Bells brews were available somewhere closer to home and this one is a fine example why. Pours black with a thin, creamy head. Espresso and char aroma. Excellent coffee taste with chocolate and some caramel.
12oz bottle pours a black color with a bit of head. Lots of coffee but not too bitter. Smooth. But still, too much coffee for my liking.

12 ounce bottle. Pours an opaque black color topped by a small dense creamy tan head. Aroma is rich with notes of roasted malt, charred wood and dark coffee. First sip yields a bittersweet roasted malt flavor that has lots of coffee flavor. Slightly smoky and intensely bitter. Resiny hops are certainly there as well. A huge stout full of flavor, yet very drinkable. The finish is chewy and bitter with more smokiness. Outstanding.
Somehow this has eluded me for a few years of looking. Thick black pour with khaki head. Lots of fresh coffee aroma. Tastes like a nice coldbrew with a light vanilla and and caramel. Love this stuff

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2015 pours blacker than motor oil almost like a syrup...no head...nose is coffee dominant...flavor is good but only if u r a black coffee person....some may be put off by this ones coffee like qualities.... personally i think it would be better for breakfast and a nap..
Has a nice strong coffee flavor and looks dark as night in the glass. Another excellent Bells.
Pours dark, dark brown, hardly any head or lacing. Rich aromas of roasted coffee beans, oak, and dark fruit. Slightly creamy. Hints of chocolate, sweet malts, coffee. Wonderful stout!
Pours a very dark brown with tan head. Coffee, espresso, raw dark cocoa, and roasted malt on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with a nice lightly sweet chocolate and coffee note.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2014 Pours a very dark coffee color, with a small head. Smells of roasted malt and coffee. Has a nice roasted malt flavor, good amount of coffee flavor and some dark chocolate. An enjoyable beer.
Had from a bottle
Bottle. Dark brown pour with a thin beige head. Aroma and taste are rich coffee, dark roasted malt and chocolate. Nice.

Six pack, 12 oz bottles. Pours with little head, dark but not black. Very chocolatey on the nose with some coffee. Smells very nice. Taste is out of this world. Seriously remarkable. Some booze aftertaste which just takes it down just a notch. But that is just being nitpicky.
draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo NY. fuller bodied black pour, notes of dark chocolate, roasted malts & coffee. not overbearing coffee flavor but enough to add a nice dimension.
This is really a solid stout. I love coffee and the coffee comes through on overdrive on this one. I could drink this all night. Unfortunately I had only bought one bottle.

Bottled 8-30-13, somehow forgot to rate this last year. Pours a deep dark brown, nearly black. Head is a dark khaki color. Aroma is rich coffee, slightly sharp, slight roast, slight soy, dark chocolate. Taste is the nose with a bigger emphasis on the chocolate. Finishes bitter dark chocolate and rolls into a delectable bitter chocolate covered espresso bean. Leaves a silky velvety chocolate finish on the palate. Very reminiscent of a nice Napa Valley Cab on the finish, almost ashy. Delicious. Medium full body for 7.5% ABV. Excellent, second only to BCBCS.

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Opaque dark brown color, heavy wavy 2" brown head, mottled curtain of lace. Nice aroma of sweet coffee and malt. Taste is lightly toasted malt that adds coffee with one sugar on the swallow, followed by mild hops to finish. A solid, satisfying brew. Recommended.

12 oz Bottle. Tasted on 12/14/14. Bottle from Lukas Liquor Kansas City. Tons of coffee on the nose. Taste is smooth with a coffee bitterness followed by espresso roasted grain. Overall a very good coffee stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black pour, mild brown khaki head. Aroma is strong coffee, chocolate, roasted malts and vanilla. Taste is coffee, bitter dark chocolate, and vanilla. Mild carbonation and mouth feel. Very good coffee stout.

Nice pour. Very fragrant aroma of freshly brewed coffee. A little bubbly on the tongue. Flavor of
A nice coffee and no alcohol aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours an inky black with a minimal tan head. Strong coffee aroma, some chocolate. Taste is coffee, chocolate malt, some sweetness, light bitterness. Perfectly balanced. Medium-full bodied, soft, and creamy. Excellent.
Bottle. Pours black with tan head. Nose is coffee and cocoa. Taste is creamy dark chocolate and coffee. Coffee bitterness in the aftertaste. Nice.
Aromas of fresh roasted coffee, subtle caramel, some chocolate. Almost black, lasting tan head. Subtle malt sweetness upfront, nice roasted coffee flavor. Full bodied.
Bottle. Pours black with deep tan head. Aroma is strong coffee, roasty, chocolate. Taste is very strong coffee, dry, full bodied, rich. Overall, very good, but very strong coffee.

Pours with a nice two finger fluffy head..really dense foam..Aroma is awsome coffee smell..kinda like walking into your favorite artisan coffee shop..taste is deffinatley espresso with a hint of burnt sugars and black coffee bitterness. Deffinatley one of the best coffee stouts ive had.

355ml bottle from New Beer Distributors, New York

Pours pitch black with a smooth white head. Aroma of coffee, roasty malts, hints of cocoa, dark chocolate and licorice. Taste is smooth, rich and full bodied with loads of coffee, dark chocolate and cocoa. Finish is smooth and creamy with loads of coffee and dark chocolate. Quite tasty and balanced coffee stout.

Pours opaque and black with creamy, toffee colored head. Nose of chocolate, caramel and a bit of the best part of waking up.

Smooth on the palate with slight bitterness and plenty of roasted malt notes. Almost takes on a porter-like sharpness that is not unpleasant but unexpected. Finished thick with lots of chocolate and coffee and a hint of spice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black, tan head, good lace. Aroma is maily coffee grounds, some dankish catpiss, roasty and bitter, almost like day old or stale coffee but good still, berry,maybe raison caramel notes,. Taste is great, the name says it all java stout and that is exactly what you get and its great, rich smooth malt, chocolate caramel sweetness, rich coffee, ash tobacco and roast. Has some grassy hops, very nice finish rich smooth, great great beer!
UPDATED: DEC 2, 2014 Great stout with a malty chocolate and coffee taste one of the best. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great coffee taste. Wonderful blend. Tan head and very dark beer. Somewhat malty.

Pours a dark brown with a thin tan head leaving little lacing. Strong aroma of coffee and roasted malt. Strong coffee flavor that is in your face, tastes like drinking black carbonated coffee that is strong. If youre not a fan of coffee you probably wont like this. Very good in my opinion.

Bottle from Maltitude. Pours dark black with brown head. Aroma of espresso, roasted malts, and chocolate. Taste is very strong of coffee and roasted malts. Like drinking warm, alcoholic coffee. Heavy bodied. Very good.

12 oz bottle poured into pint glass. Pours a wonderful opaque esspresso color with almost no head. Very faint coffee and malt aroma. Exceptional coffee and malty taste with a perfect chocolatey smoothness. My first stout and very impressed.

12oz bottle into tulip. 

Appearance: oily black. Small brown rim of head. 

Aroma: espresso, roasted malts, chocolate. 

Taste: dry and mildly bitter upfront. Long chocolate finish. 

Palate: medium body. Frothy texture. Long dry finish. 

Overall: really nice beer. The aroma is fantastic. A little lacking in body.

Poured from bottle after cellaring for 2 years. 

Opaque, brown-black with a 3-finger khaki head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of roasted coffee, molasses, roasted malt, chocolate syrup and plums. 

Taste of dark roasted coffee, chocolate syrup, burnt coffee beans and barley, vanilla and a touch of dark fruit. 

Medium/full body and medium carbonation with a very nice mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a bottle. Pours very dark brown with a fizzy tan head. Tastes like dark roasted coffee beans, roasted malt, light vegetable, syrupy chocolate, very rich. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells like rich chocolate, roasted coffee beans, light spice, and charred vegetables.

Bottle. Pours deep, dark brown with creamy tan head. Aroma is espresso, roasted malts, chocolate, faint vanilla, and faint plums. Flavor is dry roast malts, rich chocolate, smooth espresso, faint earthy notes, and some dark fruit sweetness. Medium body and carbonation.
Ridiculously intense dark-roasted coffee beans completely dominate, but somehow it works. A little chocolate takes some of the edge out. Finishes long and bitter.

Aroma, aside from the obvious coffee, has charred malt, ash, slight brown sugar, and sweet bread, like a cinnamon roll without the cinnamon. Some piney hops which are barely detectable. Taste matches the aroma, and is surprisingly more balanced than the aroma would suggest. Hops are more present in the taste than the aroma. Mouthfeel is slick and oily. The palate is medium with a very long, bitter finish that, at the end, sweetens a bit to balance it out. This is very comparable to Mikkeller Beer Geek Breakfast, but I prefer this. Great beer by a great brewery.

Bottle. Pours a black color with off white head. Black coffee grounds, burnt toast, roasty aromas. Coffee grounds, burnt, roasty, malty sweet flavors. There are a lot of breweries that do a coffee stout and a lot of times it is pretty good because coffee flavors meld well with stout flavors. But there are few beers that really go above and beyond and define the style. This is one of those beers for coffee stouts.

Fresh bottle. Aroma is a big punch of deep, roasted coffee. A touch of caramel/cocoa. Taste is smooth and deep coffee flavor with some toffee/caramel notes. Thick and velvety mouthfeel. Hard to believe its only 7.5% ABV. One of the better, low ABV coffee stouts out there.
Julie likes and thinks it's very coffee but nice. A tiny bit bitter but smoochies. Julie gives 3.5

Pours slick, syrupy darkness. Black as night. Tan lacing and soapy bubbles. Aroma is freshly roasted, robust blend coffee beans. Burlap, vanilla bean, dark chocolate malt and wet cardboard. Perhaps this is the Bells take on the Founders B-fast Stout? Gently bitter and dry with notes of fresh ground coffee beans and dark choc candy bar. Nice full bodied beer that coats your mouth with rich, delicious flavors of roasted malt, coffee and dark chocolate. Its been done before, but a really solid brew.

Beautiful dark pour with a creamy, brown head. Wow coffee! Coffee on the nose, molasses too. Drinking a bottle packaged on 8-13-13. It holds up well. Not the best coffee stout Ive had but very tasty none the less.

Dark molasses colored beer with a late-forming thin dark beige head. Nose of bitter chocolate, fine grained espresso, and a touch of dark roasted malt. Flavor is pretty much the same with the coffee most prominent. It has a medium-soft carbonation that provides a good mouth feel, but the flavor lacks complexity. Still, its a good stout that definitely highlights the coffee flavor. I just expected a bit more.
Nice black pour with a dark brown head. Coffee, chocolate and toasted malts in the aroma and flavor.

"no subtlety here...a blast of roasted coffee in the nose and more in the flavor, over a solid medium bodied roasty toasty stout. id forgot stouts were their thing til i took the first sip. very bittersweet, excellent stout, especially for coffee lovers like me."

Well then. Pours a deep brown with a light tan head. Aromas of fresh roasted coffee (store brand), roasted malts. No perceptible hop aroma. Taste is bitter and semi dry. Flavors of coffee, marshmallow, anise. Almost tastes bourbon barrel aged, really. Almost. Finishes semi thin and roasty. Mediocre.

Bottle @ Home. Pours Black wiith a small light Brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, fresh grinded coffee beans, expresso, dark chocolate,littlle vanilla beans. Flavor is malts, coffee, chocolate, dark fruit, plums, raisins,light sweettness, hints of Vanilla. Medium body, soft carbonation, raher dry finish. 210914

Draft at Moriartys. Pitch black pour with a solid khaki foam top. Lace. Huge coffee aroma. Dark roasted flavors with a nice creaminess. Notes of liquorice, smoke, chocolate and vanilla bean. Burnt campfire marshmallows. Body reads just a bit thin but has a nice silky finish. A very nice coffee stout.

Bottle 09/09/2013. Pours dark brown black with a small light brown head. Aroma is coffee, cream, vanilla, and roasted nuts. Flavor is strong coffee and creamy vanilla. The coffee stays strong throughout like a nice cup of high test in the morning.
Whoa! This packs a punch. Tastes decently caffeinated. In fact, tastes like a carbonated cup of joe! A tiny bit spicy. intense espresso notes and subtly sweet malts. Ive had better though...
an incredible stout from Bells. tastes like a cup of dark black coffee. pours black in color with a tan head. smells like black coffee. has a burnt taste as well. had out of a bottle at home.

A nice pitch black body with a thin brown head that had excellent retention. Aroma was a nice mix of roasted malts, coffee and some leather. Flavor was really heavy on coffee, Roasted malts seemed to add an almost smoky quality and a bit of molasses in the finish. Really smooth and easy to drink.

Fantastic stout! Pours darkest brown with a tan persistent head and good lacing. Roasted malt in the nose with a hint of coffee. Big cocoa front end, roasted malts in the middle and namesake java on the back end. Solid mouthful. A delicious desert beer.

6 oz pour from 12 oz bottle into snifter. Pours deep chocolate brown with a thin tan ring that lasts around the perimeter of the glass. Notes of toffee, espresso, finished with vanilla. Flavors of sweet alcohol, roasted coffee, dark chocolate. Would be amazing agreed in a barrel. Awesome Stout.

Wow! This is an incredible stout! Pours black w/ a tiny head that leaves awesome lacing! The aroma is an incredible burst of roasted coffee notes! The taste is chocolately upfront w/ some nice coffee roast at the finish. Clean, smooth, well balanced, & an absolute delight!

On tap at Whole Foods. Pours a dark brown/nearly black with no light passing. Lingering thin beige head and sugary lacing. Aroma is cold brewed coffee, with bitter sweet chocolate notes. Flavor is overall mild, slightly cigar or tobacco like bitterness dominating the coffee aspects. I am a big fan of Bells, but this seems below their usual standard of quality. Im reminded if day old grounds being reused with this one; a slightly watery mouthfeel. Bitter finish.
A bottle of good coffee, unboozy, pitch black cup of Joe, easy to like, do you like coffee, coffee!

Transfer from BA review on 2-29-12 - 
Served on tap in a 10 oz chalice glass

Appearance  Served a deep brown nearly black color with a billowy tan head. The head was rather persistent and lasted some time before fading and leaving some nice lacing.

Smell  Coffee aromas are strong. They are dark and roasty in nature. There is also an ever so light sweet chocolate aroma toward the middle and end of the aroma, but very light in comparison to the strong coffee.

Taste  Just as the nose forebode, the taste is quite heavy in coffee. The dark roasted flavor permeates the mouth in the initial taste mixed with a strong roasted malt backbone. Some bitter chocolate works its way in toward the middle of the taste. While the taste is roasty coffee and a bit of bitter chocolate in the beginning it is still very smooth on the tongue. Toward the end the taste sweetens ever sol slightly, giving a lightly sweet coffee and cocoa flavor. It is quite pleasant and a not the slightest bit harsh.

Mouthfeel  The body is rather creamy and the carbonation rather low. It coats the tongue allowing all the coffee and chocolate flavors to permeate the tongue; giving big flavors. Its very pleasant and relaxing.

Overall  This is one nice affordable coffee stout. One to try over and over again and have on many of occasions.
Pours black. Aroma and taste are largely coffee with a long coffee aftertaste. Very smooth and enjoyable.

Black pour and big amber head. Smells of roasted coffee and chocolate and tastes the same. Rich creamy mouthfeel. If the beer is too young the coffee can come off as tasting like day old brew left on the burner but this one (aug 31 13) is just fine.

Opaque, dark brown. Small tan head. Dark roasted coffee beans, some bitter chocolate notes, some nuttiness. Bitter, some slight sweetness. Heavy body, alcohol is relatively present, slightly oily. Quite strong, not particularly balanced, still very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brutally dark, no light even at the edges. The head doesnt go away. Looks like a cold pot of black coffee.

Aroma is cold mocha coffee with a touch of hazelnut. Really does have the most burnt-coffee aroma that Ive maybe ever had in a beer... but Im not sure I personally love that.

The taste has a sweet, nutty respite that isnt in the nose. Adds a rounded sweetness to what is otherwise a burnt affair.

The feel is very slick; just slides down the old gullet with nary a swallow. Its essentially a cold cup of coffee.

Aroma of coffee, I smell more Colombian than Sumatra, maybe its the chocolate. Taste is dark roast, alcohol, malts, chewy in nature, alcohol. I am torn on this one, could use barrel aging of some sort, I would hope oak or maybe a rye bourbon barrel. I do like it, but I think aging can accentuate the flavors. (I know they made an oak aged version, would have been nice to try).

12 oz bottled 7 months ago, purchased at Johns Grocery ($3.49) and poured into a pint glass at home. Black appearance with a frothy, lasting light brown head, thick lacing. Aroma of strong coffee beans, dark chocolate and dark roasted malts. Similar flavor, adding a mild earthy bitterness and a touch of vanilla and caramel. Medium to full body, creamy and smooth with soft carbonation and a rich finish. Pretty damn good, Id love to try a fresh one.

Poured from 355mL bottle. Dark black with tan head. Aroma of very strong coffee/espresso beans with very subtle dark chocolate in the background. Taste of ash, coffee, and chocolate. Taste is much more balanced than the aroma. Light creamy texture. Medium full body.

Reviewed from notes. Rcvd in trade.
The appearance was a pitch black body, half finger white head that quickly dies and has some light trickling around the sides of the glass.
The smell had dark roasted coffee beans, super light chocolate.
The taste had some bittersweetness and combined very well through the previously mentioned flavors, bitter aftertaste, dry finish.
The palate was about a medium, fairly sessionable, smooth, ABV wasnt felt.
Overall, I think this was a very well done for a coffee-forward American Stout.
bottle. Near black with small head. Thick pour with rich malt and big coffee flavors. Very smooth.

Black pour with tiny tan head.
Strong coffee nose.
Clean roasted fruity coffee front.
Light, carbonated body.
Semidry mild finish

It is dominated by coffee so no surprises.

Poured a dark chocolate brown. No head. Some carbonation. Unfortunately a poor aroma. Distinct ashtray odour. Wow, Kick in the teeth hit of coffee. Alcohol coming through. Slight bitterness on the finish. Not a fan.
Pours black with brown head. Strong coffee aroma. Taste characters of coffee, chocolate, and a little hint of cinnamon. Very good.
Wow. Aroma is all coffee. Taste is a big blast of coffee followed by dark chocolate. Finishes with some bitterness. Thin mouth feel. Good carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a deep dark brown color with light brown head. Aroma of dark coffee, dark chocolate and roasted malt. Taste is a coffee hit, followed by chocolate roast. Medium body, low carbonation, creamy with a lingering roast coffee finish with some light heat. The ending reminded me of the stout I made with a crushed hot pepper in it. Very good.

Bottle. Pours damn near black with a light tan head which quickly fares to a line at the edge. Smells like coffee, almost burnt. The smell almost perfectly follows into the flavor with a rich, not burnt coffee aftertaste. Its a little more bitter than Id like, but I fear if it werent I might consider it a coffee drink and not a beer. Definitely a treat, would drink again for sure, but one is also enough.

Well, theres no question that this is a coffee beer. Aroma is strong coffee and the taste is the same. Theres a hint of malt towards the end for me, and the coffee taste lingers for a while. If there was a little more sweetness to balance the strong coffee, I would have enjoyed it more.

Black pour with caramel highlights. Tan head with small bubbles coats the top of the beer. Roasty coffee and chocolate malt. Some oily peanut butter. Flavor is much of the same. The star is the glassy smooth, rich chewy palate. I don't know if this is the same beer as Kalamazoo stout with coffee added, but it tastes and feels like it. The coffee is a bit overwhelming. Chocolate covered cherries battle the roast. Bitterness and sweetness are in perfect balance. Roasty without any astringency or stickiness. Superbly done, but I guess the coffee is a bit much for me.

12oz bottle from The Beer Store Wilson. Motor oil black pour, zero visibility with fully lasting 1/4" thick frothy tan head. Good lacing. Aroma of coffee bean, malt and some chocolate notes. Moderate malt and coffee up front with more chocolate on the finish. As it warmed it was malt from start to finish. Medium body with a cream texture. I dig it!!
On tap at Triangle Wine Co. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma and taste are both huge coffee, roasted malts and chocolate. Nice thick, creamy texture. A pleasure to drink.
Yum. Strong coffee flavor.  Enjoyable. Dark black. Tasted at centennial beer tasting.

Bottle received by Secret Santa (Summer 2013). Thank you jsquire! Pours dark reddish brown with a small reddish mocha head that doesnt leave much trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty and tiny fruity with roasted malts, espresso coffee, bitter chocolate, ash, burnt wood, sweet liquorice hard candy, moist soil and hay. Taste is tiny sweet, bitter, tiny sour and malty with roasted malts, dark roast coffee, moist soil, burnt wood, coffee hard candy, hay, burnt caramel and hints of cocoa powder. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny roasted astringent. Finish is bitter with roasted malts, dark roast coffee, bitter chocolate, burnt wood, moist soil and burnt caramel. Tons and tons of coffee. Good thing I love coffee...

Bottle, thanks to Alex. Pitch black beer with a decent brownish head. Coffee aroma, espresso, licorice, bitter, hay, soot, tar, woody, hay, floral notes. Coffee flavor, espresso, hay, dark chocolate, cocoa, soot, tar, woody, quite bitter, figs, burnt wood, licorice, some warming alcohol. Roasted coffee finish with licorice, espresso, hay, and woody notes.
Nice heavy coffee aroma. Excellent toasted malt and coffee flavors. Very nice coffee stout.

Btl pours a deep dark murky brown color, massive creamy tan head that hangs around for quite a while living lots of lace on glass. Aromas of chocolate,molasses,cookie dough,raisins,campfire, coffee and roasted grains. Tastes of sweet toffee,dark roasted malts, bakers chocolate and dark roasted coffee beans. Medium to full body, creamy mouthfeel,chewy texture, lively carbonation, smooth lightly bitter finish. This java stout has the perfect amount of coffee on board. Bold and robust flavors hide the alcohol content nicely. FANTASTIC!!
Deep coffee brown body w/ khaki head. Intense espresso & roasted malt aromas. Coffee, smoke & more coffee flavors. Full-bodied brew.

I didnt know "Java" referred to coffee. I thought it was only some type of foreign stout. Had I known, Id have avoided this beer. Although the appearance is pretty formidable, the aroma is tremendously offputing. It is a mixture of caffeine after it has been through someones digestive system, with the acrid, bitter stench of the liquid that oozes to the bottom of concrete tanks where green & ripe coffee berries (they are NOT beans) are stored before selection. Flavour is not as bad and with much less coffee, and plenty of charred malts and bitter hops, making it closer to an oxymoronic Black IPA. Nice chalky palate, but overall this is not my cup of coffee. Beats me how this is highly regarded as a beer.
Pours a deep dark brown to black color with huge brown head. Roasty chocolate malt aroma. A lot of roast and coffee flavor. Chocolate notes.

Bottle - Dark roast coffee bean and some chocolate. Jet black with a rich brown head. Dark roast coffee and roast malts. There is a bitter finish, but appropriate for the coffee. Nice, but all coffee.
bottle shared with my pal mike Norris at club w...black pour with brown hear, SRONG coffe aroma, and taste, very smooth tho, good shit
12 oz bottle poured into a snifter.black with thin tan head..really strong roasted coffee aroma..tastes same..with dry finish..good stout.

12 oz bottle. Pours deep black, with a one finger tan head that lasts and leaves good lacing. Nose is coffee and dark malt. Taste is coffee up front, with dark malt undertones, and persists through the long finish. Very,very good.

Roasted, toasted notes and a bit of coffee beans on the nose. Very dark, clear, reddish, tan head, recedes fast. Palate is thick, heavy, has bittersweet baking chocolate and coffee. Lots of charred stuff in there too. Decent. From One Stop.

Coffee on the nose. Its really sweet and the coffee is matched nicely with the amount of coffee. This beer is great, a lot of coffee stouts are thick and overly coffee flavored but this one is pretty much the perfect coffee Stout.
A light milky coffee scent. Lacing but not very major. Thin runny khaki color head. The mouthfeel is nice, with a light chocolatey coating and soda feeling. Not too terribly complex but I like it.

Fresh bottle. Aroma is a big punch of deep, roasted coffee. A touch of caramel/cocoa. Taste is smooth and deep coffee flavor with some toffee/caramel notes. Thick and velvety mouthfeel. Hard to believe its only 7.5% ABV. One of the better, low ABV coffee stouts out there.

I drink coffee all day at work and transitioning to this beer was very easy. The 7.5% makes all the difference. It is very smooth like a Guinness with some real ass behind it. Bells always does a good job of making beer.

Black pour with a thin light khaki head. Nose is incredible with roasty earthy delightful fresh brewed columbian coffee, and a touch of bittersweet dark chocolate. The flavor has, to its detriment, a touch too much smokiness and even a whisper of tobacco, but theres so much coffee goodness, with some earthy roast, dark cocoa, and semi-bitter coffee roast that I can forgive most of it. Amazing ale.

Pours opaque with a thick beige head. Aroma of roasted coffee bean and chocolate. Taste is much the same with heavy roasted coffee, caramel malt and dark bitter chocolate notes. Extremely smooth and drinkable if a little on the sweet side. Overall an excellent coffee stout. Not my favorite version, but fantastic nonetheless.
Very good taste, goes good with all foods. Bells did a great job with the Java/Stout blend.
Bottled from decicco. Dark pour almost no head and really bold roasted espresso aroma. Taste is malts and grounds. Light alco burn.

On tap at Maltitude, Columbus GA. Pours a dark black, with thin khaki head. Aroma is crazy. Smells almost of smoked coffee beans. Bold aroma. Taste is smooth, reminds me of black coffee with a little cream. Hint of sweetness. Palate is creamy and smooth. Overall, a top, non-imperial, stout.
Thick pour with no head. Coffee, chocolate fudge, malts smell. Smooth texture and taste like aroma but with a little bit of peanut butter mixed in(weird). A good coffee stout.

Pours black with brownish thick head. Smells of chocolate, fresh coffee and roasted malt. Super smooth tastes of sweet chocolate, roasted malt and a cup of dark roast coffee. Pretty amazing. Light body medium carbonation. Only negative is it could become a bit sweet if you were to have a few.

I cannot write enough good things about this java brew! This beer had me at the first sip and now I dont look for bottles anymore, instead I seek out growlers of this perfectly balanced coffee stout! Bells hit a home run with this beer.

I poured a 12oz bottle into a nonic pint glass. It was bottled on 10/24/13 and cost $4.19 ($0.35 per ounce).

Appearance: Ink black body with no visible carbonation. Pours to a large, dark tan, frothy/creamy head which laces and retains wonderfully.

Smell: Huge nose of coffee and roasted malt.

Taste: It seems like coffee stouts are almost foolproof in a way. You take a stout, add coffee, and it just usually tastes really good. I suppose thats a really cynical way of approaching Bells Java Stout. What sets it apart from others of the genre is that the coffee flavor never fades and neither does its genuine hefty stout base brew. In fact, there really isnt much to critique the taste on - its a beer thats excellent in comparison to others of the style that are just plain good. What it comes down to is that its a little more robust and consistent. No aggressive bitterness, no sourness, no cloying sweetness. If I had to find a flaw - it would be that the palette is fairly simple. But, the flavors that are present are really tasty to say the least, so thats more than good enough in my book.

Drinkability: Another reason Bells Java Stout is better than your average coffee stout is its drinkability. The mouthfeel is soft and smooth with a silky texture and ridiculously easy finish. Theres tasty bitterness on the finish, but the aftertaste is a mild sensation of roasted malt and coffee. Theres no alcohol presence even at 7.5% ABV, though its quite tempting to binge on this brew instead of enjoying it as a liquid dessert.

1/3/14 $3.49 bottle from CBO. I'll keep it simple... This is my favorite straight forward coffee stout I've had. Dark black coffee nose and taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Logan's Alley - pours black with thin tan head . Big roasted coffee aromas with some dark chocolate . Awesome coffee flavor . One of my favs . Excellent . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Batch 9436 - 11/10/09
Poured to SA Sig Glass

A: Opaque, dark, mahogany at the edges. Little latte head sticks around through duration of the bee. Little, rare spots of lacing.

S: Even over a year out, the beer has quite a bit of the java in here. Plenty of cocoa nibs, dry nose with dark malts and full breadness.

T: Bitter, coffee-tastic. Better than I had anticipated. Quite enjoyable flavor, albeit, very simple flavor. The called it Java Stout, I wouldnt call it anything else. Very much coffee.

M: low carbonation in a medium high bodied beer, this was thoughtful. Warm and velvety, the beer feels good in my mouth. 

D: One at a time. This is a specific beer. Very nice, appropriate for the style. I cant imagine what its like completely fresh....

Serving type: bottle

02-04-2011

Draft at Whole Foods Chandler. Dark black pour with a small head. Aroma was a big blast of coffee; roasted and earthy. Flavor was like an expresso. Intense at times with a touch of wateriness in the finish. Good

Cest noir et un mince voile flotte au-dessus du liquide. Le nez est de grains grillés et de café instantané. Le goût nest pas loin des odeurs. Le café, disons que cette fois cest celui dun café filtre trop chauffé, laisse un côté âcre en bouche, qui peut paraître amer par moment, alors quune touche acidulée se glisse au travers. Corpulence moyenne. La texture, passablement veloutée aide à faire passer cette préparation qui ne me semble pas réussie, mais encore-là, je ne possède pas la vérité absolue. Embouteillée le 19 sept. 2013 (922-151213)

Aroma of roast coffee, burnt toast, and dark bitter chocolate. Pours black with a small but nice tan head. Taste is super roasty and bitter. Dark coffee, burnt chocolate cookies, and a charcoal finish. Almost too roasty but its really good.

draft sampler pour dark opaque brown with nice big mocha colored head and lots of lacing. strong roasted malts and coffee with some chocolate undertones and that is just the aroma. the flavor is grand. lots of roasted malts and coffee dominate with the chocolate underscores. rich deep and thick and delicious..

2013 bottle, thin black pour, nice bit of medium white head that dissipates pretty quick. Aroma of sweet roasted coffee, molasses and ash. Taste is a nice bit of earthy roasted coffee, fairly bitter finish, the coffee flavour sticks around and lingers on the back your tounge. Nice and drinkable, a good winter stout.
All around what you would expect. Has a very strong coffee aroma and taste. A little watery though.

Burnt and smoked flavors are risky. This beer goes a little too far with them. Flavors of smokey coffee, burnt chocolate, toast and cream. Very good feel and body helps even out and carry the harsh flavors. This may be a niche beer that you either love or pass on.

Trade Thanks to NHhophead! Bottle pours a thick oil black with a thick almost Nitro like khaki head. Nose is a black cup of coffee with a little chocolate sweetness. Taste is sweet malt up front that quickly hits you with strong black coffee. Thick body, smooth mouth feel.

Pours very dark boot-black with a bubbly tan head that settles to a nice ring and a faint coating. Aroma is coffee, coffee, coffee and some malt with a touch of cinnamon. Taste brings more roasted malt, but this is a Joe-powered experience. You might expect grounds in your mouth with the coffee-packed aftertaste, but there is some malt sweetness. A nice expresso stout that lives up to its billing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at the Funky Buddha Lounge in Boca Raton, FL. Snifter. Pours a jet black, opaque with a tan one finger head. Head gone in about 60 seconds. Some spider lacing. Aroma overwhelming coffee and dark chocolate. Taste is the same with a mostly bitter coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts. Finish is bitter and malts. Medium to full in body.
Dark brown ale with a tan head. Has a coffee aroma and a nice coffee and chocolate flavor. Goes down creamy and smooth. Delicious and well-balanced.

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2013 Pours a dark brown with a small, creamy, tan head. Aroma is reminiscent of pulling the foil cover off of a Folgers can. Just lovely. Mildly creamy texture with some carbonation microscrubbing. This is definitely a breakfast brew. From appearance, to aroma, to mouthfeel, to flavor, this would go with bacon and eggs as good as anything. Tons of coffee, dark chocolate and smoky olive. A lot of fun.
Near black with tan head. Aroma is coffee and dirt. Taste is cocoa and coffee. Creamy mouth feel. Nice.
Java color, beautiful creamy head. Smells like coffee ice cream. Chocolate, coffee with light cream.a little bitter, but Delicious. Will drink again.
From a bottle.The pour is a dark brown with a minimum head.I taste a lot of coffee with a bitter coffee aftertaste.

On tap at Barcade Philadelphia.
Appearance: Pitch black body, completely opaque. Dense dark tan head.
Aroma: Moderate strength with strong earthy and astringent coffee.
Taste: Mild cocoa on intro and throughout with a strong coffee presence dominating the palate. The coffee isnt overwhelming, but it is out of balance.
Palate: Medium bodied, moderately carbonated.
Overall: Good coffee stout, but a bit too one dimensional. I would gladly drink this again though.
Black with fading creamy tan head. Heavy coffee aroma and flavor. Some chocolate and roasted malt too. Tasty stuff.

From a bottle on rivalry Saturday , Go Bucks!!! Pours dark with foamy tan head and lacing. Thus could pass for an iced coffee at Starbucks. Nicely balanced coffee and malt with a hint of dark chocolate. Another outstanding brew from Bell's.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Oxford beer store. Nose is coffee and smoke. Pour is black and little brown head. Smooth as silk. Very good coffee taste. Would do again. 

---Rated via my mouth

Bottle. Pours black with a light tan head. A lot of coffee and roast malts on the aroma, though not overpowering. The flavor is also coffee driven - indeed, Id say its closer to an iced coffee than a beer. But its not unbalanced, and there are a lot of nice chocolate and roasted malt notes. A bit more coffee-heavy than Id prefer, but a very nice example of the style. It reminds me of a slightly less intense Speedway Stout - a lot of similar character.
Tastes like iced coffee with hint of dark chocolate. Slightly bitter finish. Was over $13 for 6 pack. Little pricey.

Bottle. Strong nose of coffee and taste of cold coffee and hints of dark chocolate. Well done. One if my favorite coffee stouts. 

----Hophaze out

Very good stout with strong but not overpowering coffee flavor. Bells continues to be a real craft brewer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours black with soft and creamy brown head. Great coffee and cream aromas. Cold coffee and lactose flavors. Excellent stout.

Bottled. Huge and somewhat foul coffee nose, seems they miss-did the boil. Even smells a bit like chili pepper. Pus cocoa. Flavor is much nicer. Huge coffee, but without the sour harshness of the nose, plus some chocolate and chili. Im not such a big fan.

Bottle. Aroma of overboiled coffee and some small spice notes. Thick black color with tan circle around the rim of the glass. Light coffee and choco initial / choco intensifies and then some marshmallow and a dash of pepper. Medium body and quite creamy. The harsh initial aroma detracts a bit, but the pleasant flavors compensate for that.

Bottle served in a snifter, shared at Tadgs. Surprisingly some chili in the nose & flavor though no chili is used in the beer. A reddish brown pour, the taste mild chili with more of a bitter coffee beans flavor. A pretty average coffee beer, Surly Coffee Bender & Beer Geek Brunch Weasel are quite a bit better.

Bottle pour of a dark black with a deep toffee fluffy head. Big aroma of sweet dark roasted chocolate malt with earthy coffee notes. Taste of same dark chocolate and bold roast earthy but smooth espresso brewed coffee. Great full body with just a light not to long bitter finish. Great coffee beer that lives up to its name and I will be drinking this again. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Rich coffee aroma and flavor with a hint of dark chocolate. Great malt aftertaste. This coffee stout tastes more like coffee than any Ive tasted.
Pours dark, nice coffee taste also with some chocolate, a bitter finish, great beer
Pours black with brown highlights and a brief, quick head. The aroma is malt, strong black coffee, a little dark chocolate. So is the flavor. Not remotely complex but delicious.

Bottle into English pint glass, deep dark brown color with light brown head. Aroma of dark coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt, ash and a slight spice note. Taste is a coffee hit, followed by bitter chocolate roast. Medium body, low carbonation, creamy, some astringency with lingering roast coffee finish. Very good.

This was one of the best coffee stouts I've had. Dark brown in color with a rich aroma of dark roasted coffee, espresso, and chocolate. Tasted awesome. Earthy coffee flavors with lots of roasted malt and chocolate. There's a sweetness to it as well. What makes it stand out is the strong stout backbone that supports the coffee flavor, many other coffee stouts wind up tasting like cold coffee, but not this. Full bodied with a long finish of coffee and chocolate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This one is pretty good. The coffee taste seems a bit artificial. Would drink this one again.

What can I say - I love coffee and beer and this absolutely excites me. Pours a jet black with a small but creamy head. Smells like a well balanced stout with roasted malts, but does not give away the taste. Coffee and malts are immediately noticeable when first hitting the tongue. Chocolate makes an appearance at the end and provides a home run finish. Love this. Most definitely recommend it to coffee lovers.

Bottle. Pours dark opaque black with a bit of toffee colored head. Aroma of spices and coffee. Taste of spices, again, with a bit of chocolate and roasted malts. Super hints of a spice without being a spiced beer.

Pours a rich black color with slight mocha head. Smell is very coffee forward, chocolate. Taste... They dont call this java stout for nothing! Huge coffee followed by chocolate, slight hop bite, char, and licorice. Thick silky mouth feel. Another great beer from Bells.
It pours a nice black body with a cream beige colored head. Smells of black roasted malt and coffee. Tastes very much as I would expect it too with coffee and malt and just bitter.
Bottle. Near black with a tan head. Big coffee and chocolate aromas. Coffee, malt and smooth chocolate.
No head but a dark coffee colour. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Taste of unsweetened chocolate with a hint of coffee. Bitter, slightly astringent palate.
Poured from a bottle. Dark brown color, medium tan head. Sour roasted malt smell. Light carbonated burnt malt flavor with a bitter malt finish.
Bottle. The look is dark, has a beige head, and is black in color. The smell is java, coffee, roast, malts, spiced, and nice. The taste is coffee, malts, roast, dark, and good.
12oz bottle. Black in color with a decent sized beige head. Aroma is of fresh ground coffee and dark chocolate. Taste is of roasted malts, coffee, and light smoke.

Pours a dark black. Coffee and chocolate comes through on the nose. Coffee all over the initial taste, a nice malty dark chocolate bitterness underlies the coffee. Very smooth and oh so good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Very dark amber color with a thin coffee head. Flavor and smell are of tobacco, smoke, wood and coffee. Rich palate with a sweet start and a bitter finish. A very nice stout.
Pours dark black with a short lasting tan head. Aroma is full and dominated by coffee roasted barley and malt. Flavor is heavy sweet with a bitter average to long lasting finish.

Dennys coffee black, vanishing mocha head. Nose is bitter coffee, heavy cream. Big coffee flavor with muted bitterness on the tongue, sweet milk, hidden chocolate center. Thick, smooth, flat with a lingering bitterness. Coffee stouts arent my favorite style but I really enjoyed this beer. Well done.

Bottle poured into a Pint glass, Bottled On: 8/30/13 One finger brown frothy head atop a black, opaque beer. The head quickly settled in. The aroma is straight coffee, it truly smells no different than a cup of black coffee thats cooled. The taste has more malty sweetness than expected. It lives up to the name, the coffee comes through strong, but Im pleasantly surprised with the balance between the bitter, acrid coffee taste and chocolatey sweetness. Full bodied, leaves behind minimal lacing. This is a top notch beer.

Bottled 8/30/13. Coffee is the predominate flavor with a medium body. A heavier texture and additional malt sweetness (higher malt bill/flaked oats) would improve this beer from very good to outstanding. The coffee needs balanced with sweetness. To taste what Im talking about, pour a half and half of Java and Expedition - the result is an OUTSTANDING coffee stout.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2013 Bottle: soft, velvety black body with a mocha head that seems to get darker with time; big, fluffy, and lasting forever. Aroma is thick and full of concentrated sweet & creamy coffee beans, light roasted malt, and a deeper, roastier coffee note in the finish. Starts off like American coffee, ends like Italian espresso. Taste has a huge roasted malt body infused with copious amounts of coffee beans. It starts off lighter, creamy & sweet, almost milky, then transitions into a darker, more bitter & roasted version of itself. Touch of black licorice in the finale, too, and quite a bit of ash left on the palate. Very nice beer from Bells. Not my favorite coffee stout by a long shot, but still a very nice take on the style.
UPDATED: MAY 5, 2014 Another solid stout by Bells. Im definitely a big fan of the coffee flavors in beer and in this one. Mark up Bells for another good one.
Big coffee smell with little if any foam. Pours very dark. Taste of coffee with some bitterness and spice. Palate is dry with coffee feel so if you really love coffee you will enjoy this beer.

Pours black with a scant brown head. Nose is like spent coffee grounds. Tastes better than it smells. Coffee is definitely in the forefront, with some caramel and a bit of ash. Decent, but not 99/100.

Bottle thanks to Bruce at the Pre-Zwanze. It pours near black with a medium light tan head. The nose is roasty, cocoa, toast, chocolate, rich coffee and some spice. The taste is roasted malt, coffee, cocoa, toasty, decent bitterness and some spice towards the finish. Medium+body, average carbonation and velvety mouth-feel. Pretty damn tasty, delicious even!

12oz bottleat Bruces, thanks to Paul. It pours a dark brown colour with a small beige head. Aroma is deeply roasted coffee. Taste is quite bitter with coffee and wood. Full bodied with good carbonation. Overall, great one
Bottle at pre zwanze tasting. Aroma is spicy veg chilli pepper. Coffee. Dark black caramel pour light tan thin head. Flavour is big choc roast spicy roast. Very smooth. Velvety palate. Really nice.
December 2009. From bottle. Dark brown with a tan head. Nice coffee aromas with roasted malt and chocolate. Rich, robust and smooth. Worldclass stout.
rich coffee taste with a burnt coffee back end. Rich aroma and a slight chocolate taste. Good coffee stout.
Nice beer. Lots of coffee not much chocolate. Pours a dark brown with a thin head. Starts dry and finishes dry. Nice beer.

From 12oz bottle. 

Pours dark brown with caramel head. Strong coffee aroma. Tastes is dominated by coffee. Decent coffee stout.

This is horrendous and I haven't even tasted it yet. It's smells like a cup of coffee on steroids. Thankfully it doesn't taste horrendous but its too much for a non coffee drinker
